sub_title: Information Technology Services Manager at Renewi Nederland
summary:
IT Professional with over 19 years of experience with specific expertise in service delivery management, project management and lean/agile/scrum.  My strengths include delivering results as committed, good analitical skills, being pro-active and take ownership. I am a reliable (honest and sincere) team player, with the ability to team up with people at any level in the organization.
I am highy appreciated for my abiltiy to effective manage crisis teams, using my coordinating and motivating skills to utilize the expert's quality in solving urgent / complex issues.
Motivated by having a leadership role, being able to develop opportunities, feeling challenged by the work, constant variety, being rewarded for results and having the chance to be entrepreneurial.

I believe that employee and customer satisfaction are key. Within Accenture I focus on agile (SAFe/Scrum) and RPA, and ensure that these are performed based on lean principles, customer focus and removing waste. Within SAFe/Scrum I do this by, for example by creating safe environment where people speak-up and within intelligent automation by avoiding automating inefficient processes (steps).

profile_positions.description:
Project Context:
The Renewi service management department consists of a group of 2 service managers and is part of the group IT department. The focus of the service management department is on global business critical IT services.

Role Description:
The service manager has a pivotal role between the internal customer (sector) and support vendor. He/she is maintaining and improving the supplier’s Underpinning Contract and the setting up Business SLA (service level agreement) with the internal customer.
In the role of Service manager Angèle is responsible for:
Determining and meeting the service levels (to be described in SLA) and for the monthly service level reports.
Maintaining a good relationship with the internal customer.
Contract / vendor management with outsourced party, setting relevant KPI’s and ensuring meeting the agreed service performance.
⦁ Initiating and implementing process and service improvements, related to change and incident.
⦁ Re-introducing Service Transition management (quality control checks) and piloting it for a complex project. Organizing smooth knowledge transfer to the supporting teams. Advising on support organization

Technology involved:
Clear, Salesforce, Sitecore, BI (oracle SQL), SharePoint, ServiceNow
profile_positions.title: Information Technology Services Manager

profile_positions.description:
Project Context
DLL has chosen to outsource their IT production support to Accenture.  The transition included knowledge transfer to both onsite and offshore Accenture India resources, and transferring current DLL employees into the Accenture NL organization. The scope was VF-EU consisting of 27 applications, in both Eindhoven and Stockholm. The support team has 5 fte onsite in Eindhoven and 2 fte in Stockholm and 30fte in Bangalore (India)
Role description
Angèle was responsible to ensure transition was done within timelines and quality criteria.
Angele created the detailed knowledge transition planning. With regular follow-up meetings and reporting to DLL IT management.
profile_positions.title: Transition Manager and Service Delivery Manager at DLL

profile_positions.description:
Project Context
DLL is planning to launch a Mobile App for Vendor Finance Europe. This is the first Digital initiative in DLL with this size (functionality) and complexity (technology and components in scope). The consumer of the APP will be the sales representatives of different dealers for which DLL has a financing option. 
Role description
Angele created a high-level project plan for the implementation of the VF Mobile App. This project plan included:
•	A high-level delivery approach for both the high-speed (i.e. mobile app) delivery as well as the low speed (backend integration) delivery
•	A project timeline, and project phasing was shared as well as
•	A high level resource plan and
•	A high level cost estimate
Angele worked closely together with the VF business counterpart, the (enterprise) architecture team and the VF Delivery Manager.
The implementation of the APP (Xamarin) is executed by a third party. Angèle had the overall responsibility for the delivery of the IT components and the budget. By enforcing that the alignment between the different parties took place adequately she ensured an appropriate progress of the execution. 
At the moment the cooperation between the different parties was stable and mature, the need of the overall program manager was no longer applicable.
Beside being the program manager Angele also had the role of scrum master for the App-development team, As well as RTE (Release Train Engineer) for the program. In this role Angele organized and facilitated the scrum events as well as the PI event.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager / RTE (scrum of scrums) at DLL

profile_positions.description:
Project Context
The new intranet is based on a Microsoft SP solution and partly replacing the old (lotus notes) solution, for the BU Health Tech.
Role description
For this Project transition to IT support is required. Angele performed Transition Manager role, and carried out activities associated to this role, include the following: 
•	KT to SP application maintenance
•	Setup of necessary ITIL process, incident, change, service request
•	Setup SLA / contract with business, and support vendor
profile_positions.title: Transition Manager at Philips

profile_positions.description:
Project Context:
Project: Implementation of JDA planning software across 3 Philips sectors (LI-HC-CL), as a partnership between JDA and Accenture, with both a large onshore and large offshore team. Project size: 80FTE. 
The F2P solution landscape contains approx. 10 legacy applications, with many (170) interfaces between them and the newly build JDA solution. The JDA solution consists of 4 modules with multiple instances. 
Philips uses a standardized Transition management handbook for managing transitions. The transition management activities are aligned with the project phases. 
The Philips organization is complex and need alignment with all individual stakeholders for each discipline and each application. There is no-one overall responsible for the to-be service.

Role description: As a transition manager Angèle provides Philips support and guidance during transition activities. 
Angèle executes and tracks issue identification and resolution, and customer relationship. 
Unfortunately Transition management was started late in the project, this needed a catch up on activities which would have been part of the design phase. 
As part transition management multiple disciplines, like architecture, compliance, legal, software asset mgt, and different support team (team leads and service mgr) are in scope. As part of her role as transition manger, Angèle ensured that all requirements were made clear, by each stakeholder and fulfilled, by the different scrum teams.
The JDA solution is new for Philips, the existing Philips support organization needed adjustments, which were not envisioned at the beginning of the project. This needed more in-depth alignment and understanding between the parties involved at a late stage in the project handover.  Angèle identified the gap and ensured involvement of higher management in Philips to bridge the gap.
profile_positions.title: Transition manager at Philips

profile_positions.description:
Project Context:
Project: Implementation of JDA planning software across 3 Philips sectors (LI-HC-CL), as a partnership between JDA and Accenture, with both a large onshore and large offshore team. Project size: 80FTE. 
The Sales and operations scrum team, consisted of 2 Product owners (and approx. 15 business process owners) , 1 JDA solution architect, 4 functional consultants, 2 technical consultants (on and offshore) 
The Inventory optimization scrum team, consisted of 1 Product owner (and approx.. 10 business process owners) , 1 JDA architect, 1 onshore functional and 1 offshore technical consultant.
Most of the scrum team members had not worked on an agile/scrum project before.

Role description: As a scrum master Angèle is responsible to ensure the team adheres to the Philips agile WoW. Originally the Scrum master role for Sales and operations team was assigned to a senior manager on the project, but as Angèle showed her capabilities she got the full responsibility for the team. As a scrum master she coached the team, performed the scrum events (Sprint planning, Daily Scrum, Sprint review/Demo and Sprint Retrospective), for both scrum teams and promoted agile and scrum. Angèle fulfilled the role outstanding, receiving multiple high score response from the Products owners, and team members.
Besides being the scrum master for 2 scrum development teams, Angele also was responsible for the scrum of scrums events, to identify and remove impediments between the development teams.



Technology involved:
JDA Sales & operations, JDA Inventory optimization.
profile_positions.title: Scrum master, RTE (scrum of scrums) at Philips

profile_positions.description:
Project Context:
Project: Implementation of JDA planning software across 3 Philips sectors (LI-HC-CL), as a partnership between JDA and Accenture, with both a large onshore and large offshore team. Project size: 80FTE. The Demand trac, consisted of 4 JDA developers, 1 Stream Lead of Philips, and approx. 20 Business process owners/key-users (Worldwide)

Role description: As a project manager Angèle is responsible for the Template design phase of the Demand Planning Products trac. 
Angele came in on a running train, on which the Stream Lead of Philips was not satisfied with Accenture's performance. Angele was able change the situation for the better, the situation was consolidated and the Philips Stream Lead became more satisfied. Angele did a good and solid job in stabilizing the situation and set a basis for the remainder of the program. She achieved this by thorough preparing of multiple workshops, with key stakeholders for different business processes. During the workshops Angele ensured that the time was used effective and efficiently, by avoiding lasting, non-relevant, discussions. After the workshops detailed minutes of meeting were shared with the group. Follow up actions were defined and Angele ensured proper follow up, to ensure deadlines, as set by the project, could be met. As such the progress improved and output increased.

Technology involved:
JDA demand planning
profile_positions.title: Project Manager at Philips F2P

profile_positions.description: Located at Alliander the IT Service Manger was responsibility for introducing a standardized and structured way of working for Service Transition. This included defining the Service Introduction process and the criteria relevant for Service Delivery. The Service Manger was operating in an organization where the Service team was newly created. The result of implementing this process is a smooth transition to support, without interrupting Service level, and customer satisfaction.
profile_positions.title: IT Services Manager at Alliander

profile_positions.description: A service manager at ASML is working in a dynamic business environment. His focus is on multiple global business critical IT services. He has a pivotal role between the internal customer (sector) and support supplier. He is maintaining and improving the supplier’s Underpinning Contract and the SLA (service level agreement) with the internal customer.
profile_positions.title: Service Level Manager

profile_positions.description:
The IT Application architect at ASML is responsible for determining the application roadmap for ASML.
The Architect is involved in the demand/change process to ensure that changes to the application or new applications fit into ASML Architecture and meet the needs of the customer.  Decisions are based on the guidelines and principle established by architecture team.
profile_positions.title: IT Application Architect

profile_positions.description: The PL SAP infrastructure and achitecture is part of large projects, or PL for technical or maintenance projects. He is responsible for the purchase and installation of the required hardware components. He is the resource manager for the implementation team, containing for example SAP basis, Oracle, Unix and windows experts.
profile_positions.title: PL SAP Infrastructuur en Architectuur
